title: The Investigation
content: The detective will [look into|look up|look after|look out] the mystery. Please [look after|look into|look forward|look for] my dog while I am away. I [look forward to|look up to|look out for|look away from] meeting you. I need to [look up|look down|look over|look in] this word in the dictionary. Watch out! [Look out|Look in|Look away|Look up] for the car! I [ran into|ran over|ran out|ran away] my old friend yesterday.

explanation-en-US:
# ğŸ•µï¸ The Investigation (Phrasal Verbs)

1. **[look into]**: Investigate.
2. **[look after]**: Take care of.
3. **[look forward to]**: Excitedly anticipate.
4. **[look up]**: Find information (like in a dictionary).
5. **[Look out]**: Be careful!
6. **[ran into]**: Meet unexpectedly.

title: Wake Up
content: I [wake up|get up] at 7 (open eyes). I [get up|wake up] at 7:05 (leave bed).

title: Put On
content: Put [on|in|at] your jacket. Take [off|out|of] your shoes.

title: Turn On/Off
content: Turn [on|in] the light. Turn [off|out] the TV.

title: Look For
content: I am looking [for|at] my keys. (Searching). Look [at|for] the bird! (See).

title: Give Up
content: Don't give [up|in]. Keep trying. He gave [up|out] smoking.

title: Run Out
content: We ran [out of|off with] milk. The car ran [out of|away] gas.

title: Get Along
content: I get [along|on] with my sister. We are friends.

title: Find Out
content: I want to find [out|in] the truth. She found [out|up] the answer.

title: Grow Up
content: When I grow [up|down], I want to be a pilot. He grew [up|in] in Japan.

title: Pick Up
content: Pick [up|on] the phone. Pick [up|out] your trash.

title: Check In
content: Check [in|on] at the hotel. Check [out|off] anytime.

title: Try On
content: Can I try [on|in] this shirt? Try it [on|out].
